I have a question for the writers and producers of "Prozac Nation": What is the root cause and what is the solution to the widespread problem of personal mistrust in our current era?
When I was a child, people could leave home for an extended trip and rest assured that their home would be undisturbed when they returned. Today, many of us lay suspicion upon our children, our spouse or our friends since we know that "[according to] contemporary Hollywood wisdom",

Near the beginning, after it's been established that outlaw John Dillinger (Warren Oates), is an egomaniacal rapist, his love story plays out over 24 times. Alternating between drama, comedy and silent skits, scenes roll by in specially timed loops. This hubris in repetition is a rarity in cinema, especially in the same space of time.
That's the price you pay to inhabit Dillinger's point of view.
